note:
要求某些供应商允许亚马逊在潜在的低于市场汇率下购买股票的权利，作为合同的一部分
   想要降落Amazon.com Amzn -0.53％的供应商作为他们的商品和服务的客户可以发现它的业务随着捕获：亚马逊的权利，亚马逊在其公司购买大型赌注，以潜在的巨大折扣到市场价值。
  根据企业申请和公司申请，若干技术和零售公司至少有十几家与公开交易的公司达成了公开交易的公司，其中呼吁认股权证，以低于市场价格低于市场价格。与参与交易的人进行访谈。
  据熟悉此事的人表示，过去十年过去十年的亚马逊还完成了75多家私人持有公司的交易。总之，科技泰坦的赌注和潜在的股票跨越数十亿美元的公司，这些公司将所有从呼叫中心服务到天然气，以及在某些情况下，这些企业的顶级股东中的亚马逊地位。
  不寻常的安排提供了另一个窗口进入亚马逊如何使用其市场的巨大，以增加其财富和污染。该公司在竞争实践中，该公司一直在监管机构和立法者的审查，包括与其合作伙伴的公司。
  虽然该交易可以通过锁定大合同来使供应商受益，但也可以提高其股价，在其中几家公司的高管表示他们认为他们无法拒绝亚马逊的推动购买股票的权利，而不冒着主要合同。在某些情况下，交易还提供亚马逊权利，如董事会代表，以及其他公司的任何收购优惠的能力。
  对于亚马逊，安排使其成为他们的供应商可以与世界上最大的公司之一进行业务的潜在众多。 
亚马逊经常利用其大小和权力来强制为自己受益的术语，包括让合作伙伴在一个企业中登录其其他服务;通过其风险资本基金学习上行技术公司;或创造顶级销售与其网站上的小卖家竞争的亚马逊品牌商品。它积极地竞争竞争对手的市场份额，亚马逊向购物者提供了更好的优惠成果。
  根据亚马逊在此交易工作的情况下，亚马逊在包括认股权证的供应商交易中，亚马逊抛出其重量，以确切的利润丰富的术语，知道许多公司不会拒绝。
  一位亚马逊发言人表示，它在商业协议中获得的认股权证通常与亚马逊必须满足的里程碑相关联，例如来自供应商的大型购买。该公司拒绝评论具体交易，或者说它行使或从此类协议中取出的金额有多少令。发言人表示，它有少于它进入的商业协议的少于1％的交易。
  去年杂货店分销商Spartannash与亚马逊修改了合同，向其亚马逊新鲜手臂提供杂货。宏伟急流，迈克基州的公司自2016年以来一直在为亚马逊提供亚马逊，但这一次亚马逊增加了一个条件：如果它在七年超过了价值80亿美元的杂货，则可以获得距离Spartannash股票的15％价格潜在低于市场。亚马逊还表示希望收到任何收购斯巴达什什的报价，并有一个10天的窗口来提供抵消。
    熟悉此事的人表示，Spartannash高管们被吃惊了解。之前没有客户要求此类条款。高管最终决定他们不想与Spartannash最大的客户讨厌，并且与亚马逊联系可以提高他们公司的个人资料，其中一位人民称。亚马逊在该交易宣布时收到了公司的认股权证，如果行使，股票的2.5％。根据合同条款，如果收到和练习认股权证，额外的12.5％，它将是Spartannash的第二大股东Blackrock Inc.
    亚马逊高管和律师在构建交易的情况下，亚马逊一直在做大约十年的卖方达成协议，但在过去几年中积极提高了这种做法。该公司在其最新的季度报告中，该公司的认股权证价为28亿美元，三年前的五倍多。亚马逊没有披露其拥有的股份的价值，因为行使其权证。
  亚马逊季度备案的说法，通过认股权证，直接投资或其他方式在公司中获得的认股权证和股权的更广泛的衡量标准，直接投资或其他方式增加了10倍至84亿美元。 
像股票期权，保证让持有人在设定期间以设定的价格购买公司的股票。如果股票超越罢工价格，则护令持有人可以以低于市场价格购买股票。
  在一系列行业和律师中的企业高管表示，亚马逊推动获得权证，因为供应商交易的一部分是非常不寻常的。在经济问题的投资者中，保证交易更常见，在经济困境中，在交易中被视为高风险。
    前亚马逊高管在逮捕令交易上工作说他们在公司开始袭击他们之前没有直接先例。对于指导来说，亚马逊团队通过2008年金融危机的金融文件中的金融文件中找到了有关涉及认股权证的银行救助的信息，其中一位人民表示。
  亚马逊发言人指出了其他一些公司的少数例子，令人犯了令人信度的安排。在2017年，澳门队在亚马逊击中了与本公司认股权证的商业交易后几个月获得了沃尔玛在插头电源中获得了认股权证。沃尔玛发言人表示，该公司非常不经常在其他公司获得认股权证。插头功率拒绝评论。
  一些供应商看到授予亚马逊的权证作为一个有价值的竞争优势。清洁能源燃料在今年早些时候与亚马逊达成协议，这可能会在未来十年内为较大的公司提供20％的股份，使其成为2号股东。根据熟悉此事的人表示，管理层从未完成商业交易，但据熟悉此事，但亚马逊已经向其他天然气公司提供了大量提出的提案，并确定了接受认股权证条款的清洁能源该人说，将亚马逊保持与竞争对手的更多业务。作为条款的一部分，如果该人表示，清洁能量必须通知亚马逊如果收到收购报价。清洁能源拒绝发表评论。
  亚马逊的首次重大认股权证与公开交易供应商交易于2016年。亚马逊正在寻求与货运飞机的合作伙伴，以帮助建立其巨大的物流网络。高管推出，该公司潜在的合作伙伴都是较小的，较小的公司具有滞留增长的较小公司，并且据熟悉此事的人表示，亚马逊的主要合同会使其股票振兴。该人说，亚马逊想要一些潜在的上行程序。
  据熟悉此事的人，亚马逊提出了俄亥俄州航空运输服务集团威尔明顿的威尔明顿的交易，威廉航空运输服务集团最初推动了逮捕令规定。它的团队飞往西雅图，并在亚马逊获得了“激烈，谈判的谈判”，其中一位人民称。 “这花了很多令人信服，”这个人说。亚马逊目前拥有约19.5％的ATSG，使其成为最大的股东。 
亚马逊高管知道需要租赁更多的飞机来处理其交付运营中的爆炸性增长，并且初始逮捕令他们要求他们要求其他公司的类似条款，其中一个人表示。
  在与Atlas Air Worldwide Holdings Amazings Amazon的谈判中，亚马逊提供了10年的租赁交易，具有类似的条款。这次亚马逊要求认股权证，达到五年多达20％的阿特拉斯股权的权益 - 以稍后的方式为10％的选项 - 取决于它给予了多少商业。亚马逊还希望在满足某些里程碑之后将导演选举主任的权利。
  参与双方的人士表示，认股权证是亚马逊与阿特拉斯合作的条件。 “绝对有一种感觉，如果没有同意没有交易，”其中一个人说。该人表示，阿特拉斯高管不想从亚马逊那里提出从亚马逊的收入机会，并将认股权证放在亚马逊的价格。
  2016年5月宣布该交易时，阿特拉斯赞成这笔交易，包括股权安排。它的股价当天飙升27％。当Amazon完成了公开交易的逮捕令时，这种跳跃是常见的，因为它宣布其协议，Spartannash的股票上涨26％。
  阿特拉斯认股权证的罢工价格为37.50美元，略低于股票在交易宣布之前交易。根据阿特拉斯发言人，亚马逊稍后举行了9％的阿特拉斯股票的股票并销售了股票。亚马逊拒绝发表评论它在其销售的地图集股票上。
    根据阿特拉斯发言人，阿特拉斯从未做过类似的交易。她说，亚马逊从未将导演的主任命名为阿特拉斯委员会。
    亚马逊还签署了包括认股权证的货车销售商。 Cargojet没有回复评论要求。 
亚马逊经常将其权证与其给予多少商业。 在达成TheelEk Inc.的情况下，基于科罗拉多州的呼叫中心公司同意给亚马逊获得20％的股份权，如果亚马逊有超过八年的开发人员的营业员每股6亿美元。 这将使Amazon Startek的第二大股东，如果是获得认股权证并锻炼它们。 Startek没有回复评论请求。  前亚马逊高管表示，他们在供应商谈判中避免做任何事情，例如将其概括书的书面形式放入，这将为亚马逊滥用权力的批评者提供饲料。 其中一位前高管表示，大多数公司遵守其对认股权证的需求。 在此次交易中工作的几位前亚马逊高管在采访中表示，他们发现他们是不公平和片面的，称这些公司没有拒绝的位置，大部分上行都去了亚马逊。
note_en:
Certain suppliers are asked to give Amazon the right to buy shares at potentially lower-than-market rates as part of their contract
   Suppliers that want to land  Amazon.com    AMZN  -0.53%  as a client for their goods and services can find that its business comes with a catch: the right for Amazon to buy big stakes in their companies at potentially steep discounts to market value.
  The technology-and-retail giant has struck at least a dozen deals with publicly traded companies in which it gets rights, called warrants, to buy the vendors’ stock in the future at what could be below-market prices, according to corporate filings and interviews with people involved with the deals.
  Amazon over the past decade also has done more than 75 such deals with privately held companies, according to a person familiar with the matter. In all, the tech titan’s stakes and potential stakes amount to billions of dollars across companies that provide everything from call-center services to natural gas, and in some cases position Amazon among the top shareholders in those businesses.
  The unusual arrangements offer another window into how Amazon uses its market heft to increase its wealth and clout. The company has been under growing  scrutiny from regulators and lawmakers over its competitive practices,  including with companies it partners with.
  While the deals can benefit the suppliers by locking in big contracts, which can also boost their share prices, executives at several of the companies said they felt they couldn’t refuse Amazon’s push for the right to buy the stock without risking a major contract. The deals in some cases also give Amazon rights such as board representation and the ability to top any acquisition offers from other companies.
  For Amazon, the arrangements give it a piece of the potential upside their vendors can get from doing business with one of the world’s biggest companies.
  Amazon routinely leverages its size and power to force terms that benefit itself, including by getting  partners in one business to sign on to its other services; learning about  up-and-coming technology companies through its venture-capital fund; or  creating top selling Amazon branded goods that compete with small sellers on its site. It has aggressively competed to wrest market share from rivals, which Amazon says results in better deals for shoppers.
  In its supplier deals that include warrants, Amazon throws its weight around to exact lucrative terms, knowing many companies won’t refuse, according to former Amazon executives who worked on the deals.
  An Amazon spokeswoman said the warrants it obtains in commercial agreements are typically tied to milestones that Amazon has to meet, such as large purchases from the supplier. The company declined to comment on specific deals, or say how many warrants it has exercised or the amount of money it has made from such agreements. The spokeswoman said it has warrant deals in fewer than 1% of the commercial agreements it enters into.
  Grocery distributor  SpartanNash  last year amended a contract with Amazon to deliver groceries to its Amazon Fresh arm. The Grand Rapids, Mich.-based company had been supplying Amazon with food since 2016, but this time Amazon added a condition: if it bought $8 billion worth of groceries over seven years, it could get warrants to purchase around 15% of SpartanNash’s stock at a price potentially lower than the market. Amazon also said it wanted to be notified of any takeover offers for SpartanNash and have a 10-day window to offer a counterbid.
    SpartanNash executives were taken aback, said people familiar with the matter. No customer had requested such terms before. Executives ultimately decided they didn’t want to haggle with one of SpartanNash’s biggest customers, and that being tied to Amazon could raise their company’s profile, one of the people said. Amazon received warrants in the company when the deal was announced that would amount to 2.5% of its stock if exercised. If it receives and exercises warrants for the additional 12.5%, according to the contract terms, it would be SpartanNash’s second-largest shareholder after mutual-fund manager BlackRock Inc.
    Amazon has been doing such deals with vendors for about a decade but has aggressively increased the practice in the past few years, said former Amazon executives and lawyers who worked on structuring the deals. In its latest quarterly report, the company valued its warrants at $2.8 billion, more than five times the level three years ago. Amazon doesn’t disclose the value of stakes it owns as a result of exercising its warrants.
  A broader measure of its warrants and the stakes it holds in companies through warrants, direct investment or other ways increased 10 times to $8.4 billion in that period, according to Amazon’s quarterly filings.
  Like stock options, warrants let the holder buy a company’s shares at a set price during a set period. If the stock surpasses that strike price, the warrant holder can buy shares at a below-market price.
  Corporate executives in a range of industries and lawyers said Amazon’s push to get warrants as part of vendor deals is highly unusual. Warrant deals have more commonly been used by investors who back companies in financial trouble, in deals deemed high risk.
    Former Amazon executives who worked on warrant deals said they found no direct precedent before the company began striking them. For a guide, an Amazon team sleuthed through financial documents from the 2008 financial crisis to find information about bank bailouts that involved warrants, one of the people said.
  The Amazon spokeswoman pointed to a few examples of other companies striking warrant arrangements. In 2017,  Walmart  obtained warrants in  Plug Power  a few months after Amazon struck a commercial deal tied to warrants with the company. A Walmart spokeswoman said the company very infrequently obtains warrants in other companies. Plug Power declined to comment.
  Some suppliers see granting Amazon warrants as a worthwhile competitive advantage.  Clean Energy Fuels  struck a deal with Amazon earlier this year that could give the larger company a 20% stake over the next decade, making it the No. 2 shareholder. Management had never done a commercial deal where it gave the customer warrants, according to a person familiar with the matter, but Amazon had put out a large request for proposals from other natural-gas companies, and Clean Energy determined that accepting the terms of warrants would keep Amazon from choosing to do more business with competitors, the person said. As part of the terms, Clean Energy must notify Amazon if it receives a takeover offer, the person said. Clean Energy declined to comment.
  Amazon’s first major warrants deal with a publicly traded vendor came in 2016. Amazon was seeking a partner with cargo planes to help build out its massive logistics network. Executives reasoned that the company’s potential partners were all smaller, lesser-known companies with stagnant growth, and that a major contract from Amazon would invigorate their stocks, according to a person familiar with the matter. Amazon wanted some of that potential upside, the person said.
  Amazon proposed a deal, with warrants, to Wilmington, Ohio-based  Air Transport Services Group  The aircraft-leasing company initially pushed back on the warrant stipulation, according to people familiar with the matter. Its team flew to Seattle and had “intense, protracted negotiations” where Amazon got ATSG to agree to the structure, one of the people said. “It took a lot of convincing,” the person said. Amazon currently owns around 19.5% of ATSG, making it the biggest shareholder.
      Amazon executives knew it would need to lease many more planes to handle explosive growth in its delivery operation, and the initial warrant deal emboldened them to demand similar terms from other companies, said one of the people involved.
  In talks with  Atlas Air Worldwide Holdings  Amazon broached a 10-year leasing deal, with similar terms. This time Amazon demanded warrants that would amount to up to 20% of Atlas’s equity over five years—with an option for 10% more later—depending on how much business it gave Atlas. Amazon also wanted the right to elect a director to Atlas’s board, after meeting certain milestones.
  People involved on both sides said that warrants were a condition of Amazon partnering with Atlas. “There was definitely a sense that if it wasn’t agreed to there wouldn’t be a deal,” said one of the people. Atlas executives didn’t want to pass up the revenue opportunity from Amazon and viewed giving up the warrants as the price of doing business with Amazon, said the person.
  When it announced the deal in May 2016, Atlas lauded the deal, including the equity arrangement. Its share price soared 27% that day. Such jumps have been common when Amazon has done warrant deals with publicly traded suppliers—SpartanNash’s stock rose 26% on the day it announced its agreement.
  The strike price for the Atlas warrants was $37.50, slightly below where the shares were trading before the deal was announced. Amazon later exercised warrants for 9% of Atlas’ stock and sold the shares, according to an Atlas spokeswoman. Amazon declined to comment on how much it made on its sale of Atlas stock.
    Atlas has never done a similar deal, according to the Atlas spokeswoman. Amazon never named a director to Atlas’s board, she said.
    Amazon also signed a vendor deal with  Cargojet  that included warrants. Cargojet didn’t respond to requests for comment.
  Amazon often ties its warrants to how much business it gives a supplier. In a deal with Startek Inc., the Colorado-based call-center company agreed to give Amazon the right to acquire 20% of its shares if Amazon does $600 million of business with Startek over eight years. That would make Amazon Startek’s second-largest shareholder, if it were to obtain the warrants and exercise them. Startek didn’t respond to requests for comment.
  Former Amazon executives said they avoided doing anything during supplier negotiations, such as putting its ultimatums in writing, that would give fodder to critics who have said Amazon abuses its power. One of the former executives said that most companies complied with its demands over warrants. Several former Amazon executives who worked on such deals said in interviews that they found them to be unfair and one-sided, saying the companies weren’t in a position to refuse and that most of the upside went to Amazon.
title: 消息来源和文件：作为合同的一部分，亚马逊在供应商中的股份制定了80多种优惠，通常在市场低于市场价格，如何利用其权力
title_en: Sources and docs: as part of contracts, Amazon has made 80+ deals for stakes in suppliers, often at below-market prices, a sign of how it leverages its power

note:
联盟，伦敦，6月29日（路透社） -  TP ICAP（TCAPI.L），世界＆＃39;最大的Instumer经纪人，正在推出一个带有富达投资和标准特许的加密货币交易平台和数码资产监护单位。星期二。
 机构投资者今年的加密部门加热到了加密部门，该平台将于今年下半年推出，最初允许他们交易比特币，第二大令牌以太网将被稍后添加。
 TP ICAP和12月的风险投资（Stan.l）和北方信托的风险投资和北极信托队推出的富达数字资产和Zodia监护权，正在寻求将加密交易类似于股票，债券和外国等传统资产的贸易交换。
 该平台将提供与数字资产保管人网络的贸易贸易基础设施，并在一份声明中表示，并单独执行和结算，被广泛被视为更大的风险厌恶投资者在新兴加密市场中参与的关键。
 目前，加密执行和监护服务通常在一个场地中卷起，增加信用风险。基于阿姆斯特丹的流量交易员将为平台提供流动性。
 TP ICAP通过提供新的数据和分析服务和推出新产品，通过全球资本市场扩大了其占地面积。
 专门的加密资金已经看到了今年的唱片流量，但主要银行提供通道必须与与加密货部门长期相关的符合性头痛和监管机构增加审查，这必须平衡增长的兴趣。阅读更多 
尽管如此，该举措是渣打银行的最新认可，其风险投资单位本月早些时候表示，它将在英国和欧洲建立一个单独的加密经纪和交流平台，与香港＆＃39; S BC技术集团（ 0863.hk）。阅读更多
 ＆＃34;投资者对这个新的资产阶级的兴趣在过去的六到八个月里爆炸了，而＃34; Duncan Trenholme，TP ICAP的数字资产的联合主管，告诉路透社。 ＆＃34;在我们与客户的大多数对话中，他们希望从执行能力与当前存在的模型相反的执行能力分离。＆＃34;
 TP ICAP于2019年推出比特币期货和CME的选项，现在计划推出其他衍生产品，包括总回报互换和不可交付的前锋。
 该平台正在等待英国的批准和金融监管机构。 TP ICAP表示，既未投资于该平台，仍未投入净化的租赁或保真投资。
 （此故事重新排放到标题，第9和第11段中的名称中添加丢弃的字母）
note_en:
LONDON, June 29 (Reuters) - TP ICAP  (TCAPI.L), the world's biggest interdealer broker, is launching a cryptocurrency trading platform with Fidelity Investments and Standard Chartered's digital assets custody unit, the consortium said on Tuesday.
 Institutional investors have warmed to the crypto sector this year and the platform, which is due to launch in the second half of the year, will initially allow them to trade bitcoin , with second-largest token ether to be added later.
 TP ICAP, along with Fidelity Digital Assets and Zodia Custody, launched by the venture capital arm of Standard Chartered  (STAN.L) and Northern Trust in December, is seeking to make crypto trading akin to that of traditional assets like stocks, bonds and foreign exchange.
 The platform will offer post-trade infrastructure with a network of digital asset custodians, the consortium said in a statement, and separate execution and settlement, something widely seen as key to greater involvement of larger risk-averse investors in the emerging crypto market.
 At present, crypto execution and custody services are usually rolled up in one venue, increasing credit risks. Amsterdam-based Flow Traders will provide liquidity to the platform.
 TP ICAP has broadened its footprint in global capital markets by offering new data and analytics services and rolling out new products.
 Dedicated crypto funds have seen record flows this year but major banks offering access must balance growing interest with the compliance headaches long associated with the cryptocurrency sector and increasing scrutiny by regulators.   read more
 Still, the move is the latest endorsement of the sector by Standard Chartered, whose venture capital unit said earlier this month it will set up a separate crypto brokerage and exchange platform in Britain and Europe, with Hong Kong's BC Technology Group  (0863.HK).   read more
 "Investor interest in this new asset class has exploded dramatically in the last six to eight months," Duncan Trenholme, co-head of digital assets at TP ICAP, told Reuters. "In most of our conversations with clients, they want a separation of custodial roles from execution capabilities which is opposite to the models that exist currently."
 TP ICAP launched bitcoin futures and options on CME in 2019 and now plans to launch other derivative products including total return swaps and non-deliverable forwards.
 The platform is awaiting approval by Britain's financial regulator. Neither Standard Chartered nor Fidelity Investments have invested in the platform, TP ICAP said.
 (This story refiles to add dropped letters to name in headline, 9th and 11th paragraphs)
title: 世界上最大的Interdealer经纪人TP ICAP表示，它正在推出具有保真投资和标准特许的加密货币交易平台
title_en: TP ICAP, the world's largest interdealer broker, says it is launching a cryptocurrency trading platform with Fidelity Investments and Standard Chartered

note:
我们在我们的EC-1中详细探讨的400人公司，由Luis von Ahn，Captcha和Recaptcha的发明者和Severin黑客共同创立。其故事最明显的比特之一？它是作为当时稀有的Edtech消费者业务被货币化的途径。该公司有一段有点迂回的旅程 - 充满了试用和错误 - 寻找完美的商业模式。它最终降落在订阅上，这归功于其使命提供免费教育。
   绝大多数Duolingo的收入来自订阅。例如，在最近的日历年度，Edtech Giant从订阅收入中生成了总顶线的73％。该收入随后是2020年的广告收入和Duolingo英语考试（DEC），其中代表其顶级的17％和10％。（特别是，Von Ahn希望DEC将是Duolingo截至2019年的20％，a图中未能达到的数字。）
  它的多件商业模式似乎正在付清。该公司的收入从2019年的7080万美元增加到2020年的16170万美元，增加了129％。当然，其中一些增长将发生在最近的全球大流行中，但并不难以看到数据中有一些与会相关的加速度。 Duolingo还在2021年的第一季度报告了5540万美元的收入，占年前期间的97％。
  但在更严格的会计条款中，净损失已为Duolingo种植。例如，在3月31日止三月31日止三个月，该公司净亏损1350万，与去年同期相比，净亏损率为220万美元。从2019年到2020年，公司的GAAP净亏损从1360万美元扩大到1580万美元。
 应该指出的是，公司的净利润在2020年改善，因为它的收入增加了一倍多，而其损失几乎没有悄悄地疲惫不堪。该公司的盈利能力或缺乏在即将上市期间不应该成为一个问题。
 在其S-1申请中，Duolingo提供了一个占位符1亿美元的资金，用于筹集资金;当它在其路演后，我们会更好地了解Edtech Unicorn在IPO期间在其IPO期间船上的资金。
 前初创公司有效地启动了Q3 2021 IPO季节，其中一些发明人告诉TechCrunch将超过活跃。 
Duolingo迄今为止已筹集了18330万美元的风险投资。公司在公司有意义的投资者包括Newview Capital，Union Square Ventures，Capitalg，Kleiner Perkins和Allantic，最近通过二级交易在Cap桌上找到了一个点。
 今天的运行率约为2.2亿美元，增长超过100％，Duolingo不应有问题清除其私人设定的24亿美元的价格标签。除非公众市场投资者感到关切的，否则埃德科市场的增长大多是在它的背后。 Duolingo在第一季度增长了近100％，这可能会锻炼这些问题。
   TechCrunch仍然可以通过Duolingo的IPO归档来挖掘它，但我们发现了许多细节，可以为最近的增长和业务结果增加了多种。以下是一些练习：
 2020年的“记录低”的磨损率，其中只有四名员工，或其2％的劳动力离开了公司。
 该公司最终计划在其提供的语言中启动“Duolingo Patch Cate Packs”，希望创建“广泛接受的语言能力水平指标，并使Duolingo全球水平标准”。
 它引用了Apple的“Translate”工具，一个IOS应用程序在2020年推出，允许用户在几种语言之间翻译文本句子或语音，作为“风险因素”部分中的竞争对手。
 最后，它确认它正在寻求潜在的收购候选人，以向其启动添加互补服务。
note_en:
The 400-person company,  which we explored in great detail in our EC-1, was co-founded by Luis von Ahn, the inventor of CAPTCHA and reCAPTCHA, and Severin Hacker. One of the most revealing bits of its story? It’s a route to monetization as a then rare edtech consumer business based outside of Silicon Valley. The company has had a somewhat circuitous journey — full of trial and error — on finding the perfect business model. It eventually landed on subscriptions, despite an original distaste for it thanks to its mission to provide free education.
   The vast majority of Duolingo’s revenue comes from subscriptions. In the most recent calendar year, for example, the edtech giant generated 73% of its total top line from subscription incomes. That revenue was followed by advertising incomes and the Duolingo English Test (DET), which represented 17% and 10% of its top line in 2020. (Notably, von Ahn hoped that  the DET would be 20% of Duolingo’s revenue by 2019, a figure that it failed to reach by some margin.)
  Its multi-part business model appears to be paying off. The company’s revenue grew from $70.8 million in 2019 to $161.7 million in 2020, a 129% increase. Of course some of that growth would have happened sans the recent global pandemic, but it’s not hard to see some COVID-related acceleration in the figures. Duolingo also reported $55.4 million in revenue during the first quarter of 2021, representing a 97% growth from the year-ago period.
  But in more strict accounting terms, net losses have grown for Duolingo. In the three months ended March 31, 2021, for example, the company had net losses of 13.5 million, a sharp increase compared to the same period last year when it had net losses of $2.2 million. And from 2019 to 2020, the company’s GAAP net losses expanded from $13.6 million to $15.8 million.
 It should be noted that the company’s net margin improved in 2020, as its revenue more than doubled and its losses barely crept higher. The company’s profitability or lack thereof should not prove to be a problem during its impending listing.
 In its S-1 filing, Duolingo provided a placeholder $100 million figure for the funds it expects to raise; we’ll get a better idea of how much capital the edtech unicorn may onboard during its IPO when it sets an IPO price range after its roadshow.
 The former startup is effectively the kick-off to the Q3 2021 IPO season, one that several inventors have told TechCrunch will be more than active.
 Duolingo has raised $183.3 million in venture capital to date. Investors that have meaningful stakes in the company include NewView Capital, Union Square Ventures, CapitalG, Kleiner Perkins, and General Atlantic, which  recently got a spot on the cap table through a secondary transaction.
 At a run rate of around $220 million today and growth of more than 100%, Duolingo should not have a problem clearing its privately set $2.4 billion price tag. Unless public-market investors are concerned that the edtech market’s growth is mostly behind it. That Duolingo grew by nearly 100% in the first quarter could temper such concerns.
   TechCrunch is still digging its way through Duolingo’s IPO filing, but we’ve found a number of details that add more than a little color to its recent growth and business results. Here are some standouts:
 A “record low” attrition rate in 2020 in which only four employees, or 2% of its workforce left the company.
 The company eventually plans to launch a “Duolingo Proficiency Score” across its offered languages, with the hopes of creating a “widely accepted indicator of language proficiency level and make Duolingo a global proficiency standard.”
 It cited Apple’s “Translate” tool, an iOS app launched in 2020 that allows users to translate text sentences or speech between several languages, as a competitor in the ‘risk factors’ section.
 And finally,  it confirmed that it is seeking potential acquisition candidates to add complementary services to its startup.
title: Duolingo文件为美国IPO，揭示了2020年的收入增长了129％，并在2021季度报告了55.4米的收入
title_en: Duolingo files for US IPO, reveals revenue growth of 129% YoY in 2020, and reports $55.4M in revenue during Q1 2021

note:
惠普已经推出了亭Aero 13，这是公司＆＃39; S最轻的消费式笔记本电脑。该器件重量小于一千克，它的第一座亭子笔记本电脑，具有90％的屏幕到身体无线电。
 13.3英寸机器具有2.5K显示器，16:10纵横比，400个亮度和100％的SRGB调色板。 Pavilion Aero 13具有WiFi 6支持和AI噪音，以减少视频通话的不需要的背景声音。惠普索赔您＆＃39; LL从一次充电达到10.5小时。笔记本电脑由AMD Ryzen 5000系列处理器提供动力，内置Radeon Graphics，最多可达Ryzen 7 5800U。
   Pavillion Aero 13由消费后再生和海洋塑料制成，它采用水性涂料。惠普表示，这台笔记本电脑是EPEAT金牌和能源之星，被认证，作为拥有＆＃34的目标的一部分。世界＆＃39;最可持续的PC组合。＆＃34;它＆＃39; LL于7月份通过HP.com获得，它始于749美元。你＆＃39; ll能够通过秋天从其他零售商捡起来。
  同时，惠普将宣布为其M系列显示器阵容进行两次补充。该公司在CES揭示了这条线。他们使用Eyesafe认证的技术，HP索赔减少了蓝色光，而不会影响颜色精度。使用回收的海洋塑料制造的监视器现在包括24和27英寸型号，内置音频。他们＆＃39; 7月份可用，24英寸显示器起价为230美元，更大的凡人售价为290美元。
   ENGADGET推荐的所有产品由我们的编辑团队选择，独立于我们的母公司。我们的一些故事包括联盟链接。如果您通过其中一个链接购买某些内容，我们可能会获得联盟委员会。
   由于您的隐私首选项，此内容不可用。在此处更新您的设置，然后重新加载页面以查看它。
note_en:
HP has unveiled the Pavilion Aero 13, which is the company's lightest consumer laptop yet. The device weighs less than a kilogram and it's the first Pavilion laptop with a 90 percent screen-to-body radio.
 The 13.3-inch machine has a 2.5K display with a 16:10 aspect ratio, 400 nits of brightness and a 100 percent sRGB color palette. The Pavilion Aero 13 has  WiFi 6 support and AI noise removal to reduce unwanted background sounds on video calls. HP claims you'll get up to 10.5 hours of use from a single charge. The laptop is powered by an  AMD Ryzen 5000 series processor with built-in Radeon graphics, up to Ryzen 7 5800U.
   The Pavillion Aero 13 is made with post-consumer recycled and ocean-bound plastics and it uses water-based paint. HP says the laptop is  EPEAT Gold registered and Energy Star certified as part of its goals of having the "world's most sustainable PC portfolio." It'll be available through HP.com in July and it starts at $749. You'll be able to pick it up from other retailers by the fall.
  Meanwhile, HP announced two more additions to its M-Series  monitor lineup. The company  revealed the line at CES. They use Eyesafe-certified tech, which HP claims reduces blue light without affecting color accuracy. The monitors, which are made using recycled ocean-bound plastics, now include 24- and 27-inch models with built-in audio. They'll be available in July, with the 24-inch monitor starting at $230 and the larger variant starting at $290.
   All products recommended by Engadget are selected by our editorial team, independent of our parent company. Some of our stories include affiliate links. If you buy something through one of these links, we may earn an affiliate commission.
   This content is not available due to your privacy preferences.  Update your settings here, then reload the page to see it.
title: 惠普推出13.3英寸亭Aero 13，其最轻的消费笔记本电脑，称重在1千克下，屏幕到体比为90％，售价为749美元，于7月份
title_en: HP unveils the 13.3-inch Pavilion Aero 13, its lightest consumer laptop, weighing under 1KG with a 90% screen-to-body ratio, starting at $749, available in July

note:
Accel和Canapi Ventures联合领导了这一轮，其中还包括参与现有的支持贝恩·伯克资本企业，启发资本，自制，ACREW，初级，时钟和箱体组。奥卢姆宣布了2100万美元系列A，融资距三个月差不多，并将其总量升至超过8200万美元。
 ORUM首席执行官Stephany Kirkpatrick于2019年推出了公司在学习工作结束后，由Alexa Von Tobel成立的个人融资遗址，该网站由2015年西北互联网获得的Alexa Von Tobel，估计为3.75亿美元。托贝尔继续形成灵感的资本，这是一个风险投资公司，该公司在奥卢姆的520万美元种子上汇款。在此之前，该公司还提供了史玛，其中“灵感检查”是本业务的第一笔资金。
  作为一个经过认证的金融计划者，Kirkpatrick说，她在这个国家的金融基础设施中看到了她描述的是“深裂缝”。从一个银行移动到另一个银行需要数天的事实不仅对许多人来说不方便，而且不必要，但她相信。
 “大多数美国人不熟悉ACH [自动化清算房屋）的复杂性，或者为什么需要多个营业时间才能在账户之间搬款，”Kirkpatrick说。 “但我们都不能允许钱等待5-7天来击中我们的账户。它需要即时。“
 即使它背后的技术是复杂的，她的使命也很简单。简而言之，ORUM旨在使用机器学习支持的API“在所有支付轨道上巧妙地搬家，并在这样做，提供普遍的财务访问。”
 Oreum于2020年9月推出的首次嵌入式产品，远见卓识。它是一个自动编程界面，旨在为金融机构提供一种方式实时移动资金。该平台使用机器学习和数据科学来预测资金可用并识别任何潜在风险。它的势头产品“智能地”在付款轨道上汇总资金，并由银行提供商JPMORGAN Chase和Silicon Valley Bank提供动力。
 “他们动力了我们的势头平台的后端，允许金钱在多靶中移动，”Kirkpatrick告诉TechCrunch。 “他们能够访问实时付款。” 
ORUM表示，它为一系列企业合作伙伴提供了一系列的企业合作伙伴，包括合金，HM Bradley，First Horizo​​ n Bank和Zero Financial（最近被前瞻性收购）。
 Kirkpatrick说，随着ORUM进行的交易量持续100％以上增长100％。其大部分早期增长来自口中。
 遥控公司在其员工和投资者基础上以多样性而自豪。据Kirkpatrick表示，对于一个，48％的55人前往女性，48％是“非白，”。 ORUM还加入了CAP表联盟 - 希望努力关闭种族财富差距的高增长初创公司和新兴投资者之间的伙伴关系 - 将其系列超过10％的B型转向代表性的创始人。例如，该融资包括纽接种特色基金等投资者，这是一群南亚妇女投资下一代女性创始人和多元化的团队。
 Canapi Ventures的合伙人Jeffrey Reitman（一家LPS主要由银行组成的公司），告诉TechCrunch，这些银行LPS每年进行数亿种同步交易，
 “他们需要一条途径来实现资金可以立即转移的国家，”他说。 “奥卢姆的产品为许多金融服务和金融服务业的球员铺平了道路 - 而且在不影响了重点风险原则的情况下，在更快的货币运动中参与较快的乐队。”
 对于Reitman，该公司的主要差异化是其团队，他描述了由“最佳数据科学家和空间的工程师”组成。
 “他们的许多客户考虑该团队有助于帮助设置风险拨号，以便通过裁减历史交易数据的关键数据和见解，”他们如何通过裁减关键数据和见解，“他说。 “第二，ORUM正在建立围绕金钱运动风险的最密集和最全面的数据集之一。更好的数据意味着更好的风险模型，其他产品将很难匹配ORUM的建立这种丰富的数据集的方法。“ 
Accel Partner同名Gandhi，他作为最新融资的一部分加入Oreum的董事会，同意。 他认为，在一个18个月的时间里，Oreum建立了“更改的游戏技术和一个特殊的团队”。
note_en:
Accel and Canapi Ventures co-led the round, which also included participation from existing backers Bain Capital Ventures, Inspired Capital, Homebrew, Acrew, Primary, Clocktower and Box Group. The financing comes barely three months after Orum announced a $21 million Series A, and brings  its total raised to over $82 million.
 Orum CEO Stephany Kirkpatrick launched the company in 2019 after working for  several years at LearnVest, a personal finance site founded by Alexa von Tobel that was acquired by Northwestern Mutual in 2015 for an estimated $375 million. Tobel went on to form Inspired Capital, a venture capital firm that put money in Orum’s   $5.2 million seed round  last August. Prior to that, the firm also provided Orum  with an “inspiration check” that was the first money into the business.
  As a certified financial planner, Kirkpatrick says she saw firsthand what she describes as “deep cracks” in this country’s financial infrastructure. The fact that it takes days for money to move from one bank to another is not only inconvenient for many, but unnecessary, she believes.
 “Most Americans are not familiar with the intricacies of ACH [automated clearing house) or why it takes multiple business days to move money between accounts,” Kirkpatrick said. “But none of us can allow money to wait 5-7 days to hit our accounts. It needs to be instant.”
 Her mission with Orum is straightforward even if the technology behind it is complex. Put simply, Orum aims to use machine learning-backed APIs to “move money smartly across all payment rails, and in doing so, provide universal financial access.”
 Orum’s first embeddable product, Foresight, launched in September of 2020. It’s an automated programming interface designed to give financial institutions a way to move money in real time. The platform uses machine learning and data science to  predict when funds are available and to identify any potential risks. Its Momentum product “intelligently” routes funds across payments rails and is powered by banking providers JPMorgan Chase and Silicon Valley Bank.
 “They power the back end of our Momentum platform that allows the money to move on a multirail basis,” Kirkpatrick told TechCrunch. “They power our access to real-time payments.”
 Orum says it serves a range of enterprise partners, including Alloy, HM Bradley, First Horizon Bank and Zero Financial (which was   recently acquired by Avant ).
 The volume of transactions being conducted with Orum is growing 100% month over month, Kirkpatrick said. Most of its early growth has come from word of mouth.
 The remote-first company prides itself on diversity — in both its employee and investor base. For one, 48% of its 55-person headcount are female, and 48% are “nonwhite,” according to Kirkpatrick. Orum also recently joined the   Cap Table Coalition  — a partnership between high-growth startups and emerging investors who want to work to close the racial wealth gap — to allocate over 10% of its Series B round to underrepresented founders. For example, the financing includes investors such as the Neythri Features Fund, a group of South Asian women investing in the next generation of female founders and diverse teams.
 Jeffrey Reitman, partner at Canapi Ventures (a firm whose LPs mostly consist of banks), told TechCrunch that those bank LPs  conduct hundreds of millions of ACH transactions annually,
 “They need a path to achieving a state where funds can be transferred instantly,” he said. “Orum’s product paves the path for many players in financial services and fintech — and beyond — to partake in faster money movement without compromising key risk principles.”
 To Reitman, the company’s major differentiators are its team, which he describes as consisting of “the best group of data scientists and engineers in the space.”
 “Many of their customers consider the team to be instrumental in helping to set the risk dials on how they fund transactions by teasing out key data and insights from historical transaction data,” he said. “Second, Orum is building one of the densest and most comprehensive data sets around the risks of money movement. Better data means better risk models, and it will be hard for other offerings to match Orum’s approach to building this rich data set.”
 Accel Partner Sameer Gandhi, who joined Orum’s board as part of the latest financing, agrees. He believes that in an 18-month period, Orum has built “game-changing technology and an exceptional team.”
title: ORUM提供API以帮助金融机构实时搬运，提高5600万系列B系列，使其总量升至82米+
title_en: Orum, which provides an API to help financial institutions move money in real time, raises $56M Series B, bringing its total raised to $82M+
